Text: The LORD reigns, let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad!
Context: The psalm begins with a jubilant declaration of God's sovereignty over the earth, implying a call to celebration.

Text: Clouds and thick darkness surround Him; righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
Context: The psalmist describes God's majestic and mysterious presence, emphasizing His moral attributes.

Text: Fire goes before Him and consumes His foes on every side.
Context: The imagery of fire represents God's purifying and consuming judgment against His adversaries.

Text: His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.
Context: The psalmist illustrates God's power and the effect it has on the world, causing awe and trembling.

Text: The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.
Context: This verse metaphorically describes the mountains, symbols of stability, melting before God's overwhelming presence.

Text: The heavens proclaim His righteousness, and all the peoples see His glory.
Context: This verse shifts focus to the heavens declaring God’s perfect righteousness and glory visible to all.

Text: All worshipers of images are put to shame, those who boast in idols—worship Him, all you gods!
Context: The psalmist expresses disdain for idolatry and asserts that even the heavenly beings ought to worship the one true God.

Text: Zion hears and rejoices, and the daughters of Judah exult because of Your judgments, O LORD.
Context: The joy of God’s people, especially those in Zion and Judah, who delight in God’s righteous judgments.

Text: For You, O LORD, are Most High over all the earth; You are exalted far above all gods.
Context: The psalmist adores God, affirming His supreme authority over all the earth and other deities.

Text: O you who love the LORD, hate evil! He preserves the lives of His saints; He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
Context: An exhortation to love God and despise evil, with confidence in God's protection for the righteous.

Text: Light is sown like seed for the righteous and joy for the upright in heart.
Context: The psalmist uses the metaphor of light and joy being sown as a seed to symbolize the blessings for the righteous.

Text: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous, and give thanks to His holy name!
Context: The psalm concludes with an invitation to the righteous to rejoice and give thanks to God for His holiness.
